730220f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 4th Street - 6th Avenue (Northeast).]
730220f-a.text:
A general view, northeast from 4th Street and Sixth Ave., showing
the spire of the Hetropolitan Life Insurance Building, (Madiaon Ave.,
at 23rd St.,) in the distance.
April 3, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.

to Washington Place (left), showing subway construction
underway.
View 3, being later, shows a parking lot there.
View 1: October 1, 1928
View 2: September 1, 1928
View 3: February 24, 1933
P. L. Sperr

710909f-a.text:

719231f-a.title: Manhattan: Cornelia Street - 4th Street (West)
719231f-a.text:
Cornelia Street and Sixth Avenue convergence, southwest
from West 4th Street. The Avenue is to the left. Note
the ''El'' pillars at West 3rd Street where this structure
turns eastward. The curb line of W. 4th Street is at the
lower right.
About 1900
J. J. Corell, photo
P. L. Sperr Collection
NO REPRODUCTIONS

710905f-a.title: Manhattan: 4th Street (West) - 6th Avenue
710905f-a.text:
(1)
146-148-150 West 4th Street, adjoining the clearing on the S.E.
corner of Sixth Avenue. The little white house with the
real estate office is an old frame structure. The shed to
the right was put up after the east side of Sixth Avenue
was cleared.
March 11, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, looking towards Sixth Avenue, aad showing no part of
146 except the electric sign ''Pepper Pot''.
Between 148 and 150 is the entrance to a one-story frame,
originally a cow barn, behind 150 West 4th Street. In the
1920's this was occupied by 'The Samovar'' tea room; their
sign over the entrance is still faintly legible. Since the
time of the first view the premises have evidently been
occupied by a Chinese Hand Laundry.
May 24, 1933.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

709302f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 4th Street (West)
709302f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue (right) at the N. W. corner of W. 4th
Street, showing ''The Swan,'' an old tavern at this location.
West 4th Street is on the left where the streetcar
appears. Overhead on the Avenue is the ''Eg'' line. This
was razed in 1939.
Abouut 1900
J. J. Corell, photo
P. L. Sperr Collection
NO REPRODUCTIONS

710911f-a.title: Manhattan: 4th Street (West) - 6th Avenue
710911f-a.text:
175 to 179 W. 4th Street, north side, between Sixth
Avenue and Sheridan Square as viewed from and along Jones Street.
TA ''Pig'n whistle Inn'' is occupving the lower portions of these
structures wiich at a later date (as shown in View 2)will revert
to their original purpose. No's 177 and 179 are the dormered
buildings and are nearest to the Square.
Nav 1, 1933
View 2: September 4, 1938.
P.L. Sperr
NO REPROODUCTIONS.

709304f-a.text:

710908f-a.text:

north side, between Sixth Ave., and Washington Square West. The Wasuington

eigns) is a frame structure in 2 parte.
April 3, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

710928f-a.text:

Late 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
